Always erasing: 8f81a70 and 90e8960

content.raw:
Based on your other comments, I am adding a few cases in which `ProcessMarkerMsg` fails. For example, if you mistype a namespace. 

If we kept the messages around here, it would be kind of like "latching" it, and it could take effect once a namespace with the mistyped name shows up. Which I think is not a desired behaviour, I think that once the message has been processed and failed, we should print an error and discard the message. Let me know if you think otherwise.
content.html:
Based on your other comments, I am adding a few cases in which ProcessMarkerMsg fails. For example, if you mistype a namespace.

If we kept the messages around here, it would be kind of like "latching" it, and it could take effect once a namespace with the mistyped name shows up. Which I think is not a desired behaviour, I think that once the message has been processed and failed, we should print an error and discard the message. Let me know if you think otherwise.

content.raw: If someone wants to delete all markers from a given namespace but accidentally writes the namespace wrong, it will cause all the markers to be removed, right? I think it might be less dangerous if we force the namespace to be empty when you want to remove all namespaces.
content.html: If someone wants to delete all markers from a given namespace but accidentally writes the namespace wrong, it will cause all the markers to be removed, right? I think it might be less dangerous if we force the namespace to be empty when you want to remove all namespaces.
